channel.title: CVE Feed for VMware -- Workstation
channel.description: The latest CVEs for VMware -- Workstation

item.title: CVE-2017-4936|2024-09-17T00:26:28.117Z -- vmware -- workstation
item.description: VMware Workstation (12.x before 12.5.8) and Horizon View Client for Windows (4.x before 4.6.1) contain an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in JPEG2000 parser in the TPView.dll. On Workstation, this may allow a guest to execute code or perform a Denial of Service on the Windows OS that runs Workstation. In the case of a Horizon View Client, this may allow a View desktop to execute code or perform a Denial of Service on the Windows OS that runs the Horizon View Client.

item.title: CVE-2017-4945|2024-09-17T00:11:23.535Z -- vmware -- workstation
item.description: VMware Workstation (14.x and 12.x) and Fusion (10.x and 8.x) contain a guest access control vulnerability. This issue may allow program execution via Unity on locked Windows VMs. VMware Tools must be updated to 10.2.0 for each VM to resolve CVE-2017-4945. VMware Tools 10.2.0 is consumed by Workstation 14.1.0 and Fusion 10.1.0 by default.

item.title: CVE-2017-4938|2024-09-17T03:28:55.869Z -- vmware -- workstation
item.description: VMware Workstation (12.x before 12.5.8) and Fusion (8.x before 8.5.9) contain a guest RPC NULL pointer dereference vulnerability. Successful exploitation of this issue may allow attackers with normal user privileges to crash their VMs.

item.title: CVE-2018-6973|2024-09-17T02:41:38.547Z -- vmware -- workstation
item.description: VMware Workstation (14.x before 14.1.3) and Fusion (10.x before 10.1.3) contain an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the e1000 device. This issue may allow a guest to execute code on the host.
